intro: Crotalaria youngii, commonly known as the young's crotalaria, is a flowering plant belonging to the Fabaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers and compound leaves. The plant typically grows as an erect annual herb, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its seed pods are elongated and contain several small, kidney-shaped seeds. Crotalaria youngii is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
